extendedIngredients.name: bay leaf
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 medium bay leaf or 2 small bay leaves/tej patta

extendedIngredients.name: butter
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 tsp butter for sauteing the blanched onions

extendedIngredients.name: cream
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3 tbsp low fat cream, 25% to 35% fat

extendedIngredients.name: dried coriander leaves
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ to 1 tbsp chopped coriander leaves

extendedIngredients.name: ginger garlic paste
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ inch ginger + 2 small garlic cloves, made into a paste in a mortar-pestle or ½ tsp ginger garlic paste

extendedIngredients.name: oil
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1.5 tbsp oil for the remaining gravy

extendedIngredients.name: onions
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 medium sized onions, finely chopped, 75 to 80 g, about ½ to ⅔ cup finely chopped onions

extendedIngredients.name: onions
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 medium sized onions for blanching and sauteing, 75 to 80 g, you can also add 5 to 6 button onions or small pearl onions
metaInformation: for blanching and sauteing, 75 to 80 g, you can also add 5 to 6 button onions or  pearl onions

extendedIngredients.name: choti elaichi
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3 green cardamoms/hari elaichi or choti elaichi

recipes.title: paneer do pyaza , how to make paneer do pyaza
recipes.instructions: peel and rinse the onions. rinse the tomatoes. halve or quarter the onions. you can also use pearl or button onions instead of regular onionsblanch halved or quartered onions and tomatoes in hot water. for this method, first boil water in a pan till the water begins to boil. add the onions and tomatoes and let them cook for a minute or two. then switch off the flame. cover the pan and let the onions and tomatoes blanch in the hot water for about 20 to 25 minutes.drain and once the onions are cooled, remove the individual onion layers and keep aside.heat 1 tsp butter in a pan. add the onion layers and saute till they are lightly browned from the edges. keep aside.peel the skin from the blanched tomatoes and chop them finely. also chop two medium onions finely.heat oil in the same pan. add whole spices - cinnamon, cardamoms, cloves, mace, bay leaf and dry red chilies. saute the spices till aromatic.add chopped onions. stir and saute the onions till they become golden.add tomatoes and stir. then add ginger-garlic paste. stir the masala mixture very well and saute on a low flame till oil begins to release from the sides. the tomatoes should soften and be completely cooked.add ground spices - coriander powder, cumin powder, turmeric powder, black pepper powder, nutmeg powder and garam masala powder. you can also add red chili powder if you prefer. about  to  tsp of red chili powder can be added, depending on your taste.stir the spices very well. then add the blanched & sauteed onion layers. stir and saute for 2 minutes.then add paneer cubes.season with salt and stir everything well. cook the paneer for about 2 minutes.add low fat cream. stir gently and cook for a minute. you can also add kasuri methi. add about  tsp of crushed kasuri methi/dry fenugreek leaves.garnish with coriander leaves, ginger julienne or some grated paneer.serve paneer do pyaza hot or warm with chapatis, rotis or naan.

steps.step: peel and rinse the onions. rinse the tomatoes. halve or quarter the onions. you can also use pearl or button onions instead of regular onionsblanch halved or quartered onions and tomatoes in hot water. for this method, first boil water in a pan till the water begins to boil. add the onions and tomatoes and let them cook for a minute or two. then switch off the flame. cover the pan and let the onions and tomatoes blanch in the hot water for about 20 to 25 minutes.drain and once the onions are cooled, remove the individual onion layers and keep aside.heat 1 tsp butter in a pan. add the onion layers and saute till they are lightly browned from the edges. keep aside.peel the skin from the blanched tomatoes and chop them finely. also chop two medium onions finely.heat oil in the same pan. add whole spices - cinnamon, cardamoms, cloves, mace, bay leaf and dry red chilies. saute the spices till aromatic.add chopped onions. stir and saute the onions till they become golden.add tomatoes and stir. then add ginger-garlic paste. stir the masala mixture very well and saute on a low flame till oil begins to release from the sides. the tomatoes should soften and be completely cooked.add ground spices - coriander powder, cumin powder, turmeric powder, black pepper powder, nutmeg powder and garam masala powder. you can also add red chili powder if you prefer. about  to  tsp of red chili powder can be added, depending on your taste.stir the spices very well. then add the blanched & sauteed onion layers. stir and saute for 2 minutes.then add paneer cubes.season with salt and stir everything well. cook the paneer for about 2 minutes.add low fat cream. stir gently and cook for a minute. you can also add kasuri methi. add about  tsp of crushed kasuri methi/dry fenugreek leaves.garnish with coriander leaves, ginger julienne or some grated paneer.serve paneer do pyaza hot or warm with chapatis, rotis or naan.
